scan_table_check.description: An OOTB record (Out-of-the-box) record is any record that is shipped as part of the ServiceNow platform or one of its plugins. Such records MUST NOT be moved into a custom application. If OOTB records are moved into custom application, various unintended side-effects must be expected - updates in family upgrades may be ignored or overwritten or records might be deleted unintentionally when installing or updating custom applications that contain such records.
scan_table_check.name: CodeSanity - App must not contain OOTB records
scan_table_check.resolution_details: Move any OOTB record that has been moved into a custom application back out of the app - this may be done via background script. In order to apply changes to such OOTB records, create your own version of the record in your own custom app and deactivate such OOTB records through installation scripts. See chapter "Installation Scripts" in the the linked whitepaper "A mature development and deployment process" for more guidance.
scan_table_check.short_description: An application must not contain OOTB records.
scan_table_check.sys_name: CodeSanity - App must not contain OOTB records
